snippet: Ford, General Motors and Honda, among others, ended March in losing territory. Fiat Chrysler and Toyota posted modest gains.
abstract: Research firm Autodata reports car companies sold 1.55 million vehicles in March in United States, only a slight increase from year earlier; numbers dampen some of optimism on display by automakers introducing new models at New York International Auto Show.

byline.original: By BILL VLASIC and AARON M. KESSLER

lead_paragraph: Ford, General Motors and Honda, among others, ended March in losing territory. Fiat Chrysler and Toyota posted modest gains.

headline.main: Auto Sales Slow After Months of Healthy Growth
headline.print_headline: U.S. Auto Sales Were Flat in March, After Months of Growth
